intro: Lomatogonium rotatum f. ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaf lomatogonium, is a variant of the species native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its unique foliage and drought tolerance make it an interesting addition to succulent gardens.
